thread.title: Suge Knight, Katt Williams, ordered to trial in robbery case
thread.title_full: Suge Knight, Katt Williams, ordered to trial in robbery case

title: Suge Knight, Katt Williams, ordered to trial in robbery case
text:
Judge orders Suge Knight and Katt Williams to stand trial in robbery case THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   13, 2015 - 2:14 pmLast Updated: October 13, 2015 - 2:14 pm   
People: 
Photos: 
FILE - In this July 7, 2015, file photo, Marion Hugh "Suge" Knight sits for a hearing in his murder case in Los Angeles Superior Court. Knight is scheduled to return to a Los Angeles courtroom on Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, for hearings in separate murder and robbery cases filed against him. (Patrick T. Fallon/Pool Photo via AP, File) 
LOS ANGELES — A judge says former rap music mogul Marion "Suge" Knight and comedian Katt Williams should stand trial on robbery charges filed after a celebrity photographer accused the men of stealing her camera. 
Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Ronald Coen says prosecutors have shown enough evidence to support the charges. 
Coen ruled Tuesday after hearing from the photographer who described suffering a concussion and other injuries after an associate of the men attacked her in Beverly Hills in September. 
A police detective also testified that surveillance footage showed Williams holding the camera after the attack. 
Knight's attorney, Thomas Mesereau, argued that his client hadn't participated in the robbery, but Coen said there was evidence he aided and abetted the attack. 
Mesereau says Knight was upset because the photographer had shot images of his son.
